reviewText: What a wonderful way to end the series and bring back up my opinion after the eternal 8.  I loved the series and basically would say your feelings for the series high points will be the same for the movie.
An amazing movie to round out the series. Still holding out hope there will be a Season 3!

The movie itself is a 5/5 for me. After 8 years and watching the movie maybe 4-5 times, this movie still holds up. The animation, the plot, the production, the soundtrack, the characters...are all incredible if you've invested time in the anime and come to like the cast. The movie looks fantastic in blu-ray; and the 5.1 Japanese/English audio is fantastic. Never in my life did I think that I would get to listen to iconic theme opening "Bouken Desho Desho?" in 5.1 surround. The English dub also does a solid job; I can watch the movie in either language since the English cast did such a good job.

As far as the actual product goes, the movie comes with some nice postcards and a reversible cover.

If I have to give any negatives, it would be with the way Funimation handles the subtitles and extras (of course). I currently can't find a way to turn off the subtitles; in the Setup section in the menu, there's no option to turn them on or off. I also can't turn them off through my blu-ray player's settings either. And the only extras are trailers for Funimation shows. And there's no way to select them as separate videos since they're all lumped in the Trailers portion of the menu. You would have to manually skip to watch the next trailer. I was hoping for at least a Clean Opening, but nope.

Overall, I'm glad to FINALLY have this movie in my collection since I missed out on the original Bandai release.
hands down the best anime movie out at the moment ..It is however important to watch both seasons first or you will be lost

One of the best (if not the best) anime movies of all time. It's a lot more serious than the series but brings up things from the previous episodes to make you go "Ah!!!"
Kyoto animation is one of the best in the business when it comes to directing and cinematography. You can clearly see this in The Disappearance of Haruhi Suzumiya. The directors directed Hyouka and Sound Euphonium, so if you liked either of those two you should enjoy this movie.

 I'm so happy they decided to make a re-release because I've been wanting a copy of my own for a very long time  now.
A superb end to an outstanding series, personally I enjoyed the movie more than the series

A great movie to end the TV series *cough* Endless Eight *cough*
Was very high quality Blu Ray. Came with several discs and extras. The movie itself is very well done and quite enjoyable. Any fan of Haruhi Suzumiya will enjoy this movie.
best animation movie in 2009
Definitely the best part of the entire Haruhi series.
Absolutely a must own for anime fans.

Such an amazing ending to the series and a great bridge for me to watch the new one! I absolutely love the character development in this. I hadn't watched The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya anime since I was younger, and then chose to pick the series up again as an adult. I found out that they added more episodes as well as this movies and a spin-off series! I've rewatched and caught up in less than a month and I can't wait to watch the new series about Nagato. This movie is so great, I wish I had bought the DvD instead of renting it online.
Wow.  I loved the series, but this took the story to a whole new level.  My favorite part was (classified information), when Kyon was (classified information) by (classified information).  Buy it!
If you love the Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya then this is must watch! Definitely Worth the amount and then some! 10 out 10. Great way to end the series!
Very please.

If you enjoyed the series, then you'll love the movie. The writing was done very well, and the voice acting was great. The comedy that was put in this was just enough to break up the drama without being too much. Any time an animated movie can stir strong up emotions it is an exceptional thing.
Movie is boring and meaningless. A waste of money, time and space.
Met my expectations after seeing the show and absolutely loved it.
